class="Tag-module--tag--55cfc">Platform - Licensing</span></div></div></div><div class="Post-module--container--0445e Home-module--post--60c66"><div class="Post-module--date--68cb2">Nov 07</div><div><h3><a class="Post-module--title--f0039" href="/details/pmcs37285/">Ability to use CMEK global and regional keys in Google Cloud</a></h3><div class="Progress-module--progress--3310c Post-module--progress--320fe"><div><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:#FED55E"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:white"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:white"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:white"></span></div><span class="Progress-module--stage--8114b">In Development</span></div><div class="Post-module--description--ff15f">In Google Cloud environments, you can now browse and use global or regional customer-managed encryption-key (CMEK) from all projects that are accessible to the service account. This feature enhances the flexibility to manage encryption keys. This feature requires extra permission for host connection to browse key outside the provisioning project. </div><div class="Post-module--tags--0a7fb"><span class="Tag-module--tag--55cfc">Citrix DaaS - Provisioning</span></div></div></div><div class="Post-module--container--0445e Home-module--post--60c66"><div class="Post-module--date--68cb2">Nov 06</div><div><h3><a class="Post-module--title--f0039" href="/details/pmcs38444/">Backup and restore persistent VMs in GCP</a></h3><div class="Progress-module--progress--3310c Post-module--progress--320fe"><div><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:#FED55E"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:white"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:white"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:white"></span></div><span class="Progress-module--stage--8114b">In Development</span></div><div class="Post-module--description--ff15f">With this feature, you can backup a persistent VM in GCP using snapshots. The snapshot will retain the disk and VM configuration content. You can later restore individual VMs to a previous status using a specified snapshot you choose.</div><div class="Post-module--tags--0a7fb"><span class="Tag-module--tag--55cfc">Citrix DaaS - Provisioning</span></div></div></div><div class="Post-module--container--0445e Home-module--post--60c66"><div class="Post-module--date--68cb2">Nov 03</div><div><h3><a class="Post-module--title--f0039" href="/details/pmcs33083/">MCS support for Azure Monitor Agent</a></h3><div class="Progress-module--progress--3310c Post-module--progress--320fe"><div><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:#91DC71"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:#91DC71"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:#91DC71"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:#91DC71"></span></div><span class="Progress-module--stage--8114b">Now Available</span></div><div class="Post-module--description--ff15f">Azure Monitor Agent is a built-in Azure service that collects and analyzes your telemetry data from Azure and hybrid VMs. This data is then used to support features, insights, and other services. With this new feature, MCS can individually provision VMs with Azure Monitor agent installed and enabled using the machine profile.</div><div class="Post-module--tags--0a7fb"><span class="Tag-module--tag--55cfc">Citrix DaaS - Provisioning</span></div></div></div><div class="Post-module--container--0445e Home-module--post--60c66"><div class="Post-module--date--68cb2">Nov 03</div><div><h3><a class="Post-module--title--f0039" href="/details/dir19430/">Actions - Session Recording</a></h3><div class="Progress-module--progress--3310c Post-module--progress--320fe"><div><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:#FED55E"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:white"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:white"></span><span class="Progress-module--dot--4e83a" style="background-color:white"></span></div><span class="Progress-module--stage--8114b">In Development</span></div><div class="Post-module--description--ff15f">Citrix DaaS Monitor now supports the ability to trigger Dynamic Session Recordings on user sessions via the console. Customers with Session Recording enabled on their environment can avail this feature for shadowing and troubleshooting.
Citrix Session Recording is part of every DaaS edition and with this available to every Citrix DaaS customer.</div><div class="Post-module--tags--0a7fb"><span class="Tag-module--tag--55cfc">Citrix DaaS - Monitor Console</span></div></div></div><div class="Post-module--container--0445e Home-module--post--60c66"><div class="Post-module--date--68cb2">Nov 03</div><div><h3><a
